MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES
BUREAU OF CHILDREN AND ADULT LICENSING
ADDENDUM TO ORIGINAL LICENSING STUDY REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CB810201018
Licensee Name: Catholic Social Services of Washtenaw
Licensee Address: 4925 Packard Rd
Ann Arbor, MI 481081521
Licensee Telephone #: (734) 971-9781
Administrator/Licensee Designee: Lawrence Voight, Administrator
David Garvin, Designee
Name of Facility: Catholic Social Services Of Washtenaw
Facility Address: 4925 Packard Road
Ann Arbor, MI 48108-1521
Facility Telephone #: (734) 971-9781
Capacity:
Program Type: CHILD PLACING AGENCY, PRIVATE
1

II. Purpose of Addendum
Catholic Social Services of Washtenaw would like to add a foster care program to
their current adoption program.
III. Methodology
In November 2012, CSS administration expressed a desire to expand their license to
include a foster care program. The facility has adequate space and resources to
accommodate this change. A proposed budget for the program was reviewed and
found to be clear and inclusive of their income and expenses.
They have hired an MSW level Foster Care and Licensing Supervisor with
seventeen years of experience. This supervisor has CWTI supervisor training,
Certification and Complaint training completed. Appropriate job descriptions have
been developed for a foster care worker, licensing worker, and the foster
care/licensing supervisor. The agency plans to hire licensing and foster care workers
upon approval of this license addendum.
The agency has provided copies of all required policies and procedures.
Additionally, agency staff were open to feedback and made adjustments as
recommended. The foster parent handbook, including policies and procedures, was
reviewed and covered all areas required.
The agency has identified recruitment and retention strategies and has joined the
Washtenaw County coalition, in order to strengthen their efforts.
Additionally, CSS is in the process of obtaining a foster care contract with the State
of Michigan. The foster care program will be located in the current CSS Washtenaw
County office. However, the agency plans to also work with Jackson, Livingston,
Lenawee, Hillsdale, Branch, and Monroe counties.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
Overall it seems that Catholic Social Services has a solid understanding of the
requirements for an agency to run a foster care program. They have formed
partnerships with other agencies through the Washtenaw County Coalition and
understand the needs of this area.
After reviewing their policies, procedures and budget, it appears that CSS is
prepared to launch their FC program with a thorough understanding of licensing
expectations, MSA requirements and DHS policies.
2

V. Recommendation
The recommendation is to add the following service types to the existing CSS
license: Certify foster homes for license, Place children in foster homes
3/5/2013
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
3
